link.text: View the DEFAULT_PROJECT Genomic Sequence Page for an Example Sequence
link.description: The Genomic Sequence Page is a view of a chromosome, contig, or scaffold. We provide summary information, a link to the Genome Browser, and a form for sequence retrieval. All Genomic Sequence Searches return this type of record.

link.text: View a partial region of an Example Sequence in the DEFAULT_PROJECT Genome Browser
link.description: Each Sequence for this dataset can be browsed using the Genome Browser. Here we provide a sample region with tracks which are available for all sequences.

link.text: View the DEFAULT_PROJECT Organism Record Page
link.description: The Organism Record page contains a summary of the different types of data associated with this organism. How many genes? Does this organism have RNA Sequence Data? ...
Go to download directory for Current Relase of this particular organism.

link.text: Run BLAST on sequences in DEFAULT_PROJECT
link.description: BLAST finds regions of similarity between sequences. The program compares nucleotide or protein sequences to sequence databases and calculates the statistical significance of matches. VEuPathDB BLAST accommodates inputs such as a single sequence or several FASTA-formatted sequences at once, i.e., is multi-query capable.
